original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.22. Kusalattika, Cittānuparivattadukādi🔽Kusalaṁ cittānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca … (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi           kusalam citta anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate terasa
translated: The order of the dhammas, the reverse order, the triplets, the dyads, and the Paṭṭhāna text🔽The profitable triad, the dyads that accompany consciousness, etc.🔽With a profitable consciousness-originated dhamma as condition there arises … (Abridged.) In the case of cause, thirteen; in the case of object, nine; … in the case of prenascence, nine; … in the case of nutriment, four; … in the case of dissociation, thirteen.

original: Kusalaṁ nocittānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca … (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate terasa. (Ete saṅkhittā, dukattayaṁ cittadukasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: kusalam no citta anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate terasa ete saṅkhittā duka ttayam citta duka sadisa
translated: With a profitable dhamma that is not consciousness-originated as condition … (Abridged.) In the case of cause, thirteen; in the case of object, nine; … in the case of nutriment, four; … in the case of dissociation, thirteen. (These are abridged. The dyads are similar to the dyads in the consciousness triad.)
